For the last few weeks, the Snowstorm team has been hard at work trying to
squish a bug (or what we thought was a bug) in Openglad. The bug was
that the AI would pick a victim in the beginning of the level and go
relentlessly after him/her until it (the ai) was attacked by someone
else.

Many a night has been spent trying to find the source of this bug, and
just now Odo suggested that I try the dos binary for 3.8k. I tried it, and
it turns out AI behaves that way there as well.

Now, most of my Gladiator memories come from 3.8G, which I've played for
years, but the AI in 3.8G is much more easy going. For example, the elves
on the first level walk around the edges of the map instead of
slaughtering your guys like madmen.

Does anyone know for sure how the AI was designed to act, or at least how
you guys expect it to act? The Snowstorm team will sleep easier at night
knowing that there are no AI bugs in Openglad (or at least be prepared if
there _are_ bugs in there).

- Zardus
